definitions.definition: A pound (unit of weight).
Leg bye
One who plays association football.
(Australia and sometimes United States) A road junction at which traffic streams circularly around a central island.
A horizontal wheel which rotates around a central axis when pushed and on which children ride, often found in parks as a children's play apparatus.
A fairground carousel.
A detour.
A short, close-fitting coat or jacket worn by men or boys, especially in the 19th century.
A round dance.
Indirect, circuitous, or circumlocutionary.
Encircling; enveloping; comprehensive.
Extremely afraid.
To harden organic matter by permeating with water and depositing dissolved minerals.
To produce rigidity akin to stone.
To immobilize with fright.
To become stone, or of a stony hardness, as organic matter by calcareous deposits.
To become stony, callous, or obdurate.
To make callous or obdurate; to stupefy; to paralyze; to transform; as by petrification.
An echinoderm of the class Holothuroidea, with an elongated body and leathery skin.
To fit out with a harness or other equipment.
To equip and fit (a ship) with sails, shrouds, and yards.
To dress or clothe in some costume.
To make or construct something in haste or in a makeshift manner.
definitions.example: rig up a makeshift shelter

definitions.definition: To manipulate something dishonestly for personal gain or discriminatory purposes.
definitions.example: to rig an election

definitions.definition: To make free with; hence, to steal; to pilfer.
To outfit a model with controls for animation.
To play the wanton; to act in an unbecoming manner; to play tricks.
Dress; tackle; especially , the ropes, chains, etc., that support the masts and spars of a sailing vessel, and serve as purchases for adjusting the sails, etc.
Similar supporting material used for construction work, or in film, theater, etc.
The trefoil leaf of any small clover, especially Trifolium repens, or such a leaf from a clover-like plant, commonly used as a symbol of Ireland.
definitions.example: She wore a shamrock in honor of her Irish ancestry.

definitions.definition: Any of several small plants, forms of clover, with trefoil leaves, especially Trifolium repens.
definitions.example: The fields were covered with shamrocks.

definitions.definition: A soldier who is not a member of an official military force and, often, does not follow regular army tactics
One who does not regularly attend a venue
Nonstandard; not conforming to rules or expectations
(of a surface) rough
Without symmetry, regularity, or uniformity
(of a polygon) not regular; having sides that are not equal or angles that are not equal
(of a polyhedron) whose faces are not all regular polygons (or are not equally inclined to each other)
(grammar, of a word) not following the regular or expected patterns of inflection in a given language
definitions.example: "Calves", "cacti", and "children" are irregular plurals.

definitions.definition: Not having the desired effect; ineffectual
Lacking in ability; incompetent or inadequate
One who writes computer programs; a software developer.
One who decides which programs will be shown on a television station, or which songs will be played on a radio station.
A device that installs or controls a software program in some other machine.
A short film feature as part of a longer film program.
Any item used for personal hygiene or grooming.
The process of becoming less active or severe.
A sinking of something to a lower level, especially of part of the surface of the Earth due to underground excavation or seismic activity or groundwater depletion
To begin an activity immediately and with full commitment.
definitions.example: Employers these days look for candidates that can hit the ground running, so that they spend less on training.

definitions.definition: To fall headlong from a horse.
To suffer some accident or misfortune; to fail.
definitions.example: She came a cropper on the stairs and broke her leg.

definitions.definition: A guarantee that a certain outcome or obligation will be fulfilled; security.

An obsolete legal agreement that was a real covenant and ran with the land, whereby the grantor and his heirs of a piece of real estate held in freehold were required to officially guarantee their claim and plead one’s case for the title. If evicted by someone with a superior claim (paramount title) they were also required to hand over other real estate of equal value in recompense. It has now been replaced by personal covenants and the covenant of warranty.

A legal agreement, either written or oral (an expressed warranty) or implied through the actions of the buyer and seller (an implied warranty), which states that the goods or property in question will be in exactly the same state as promised, such as in a sale of an item or piece of real estate.
A written guarantee, usually over a fixed period, provided to someone who buys a product or item, which states that repairs will be provided free of charge in case of damage or a fault.
definitions.example: I made sure to check the terms of my warranty for my computer to ensure I was covered in case it broke down.

definitions.definition: (insurance law) A stipulation of an insurance policy made by an insuree, guaranteeing that the facts of the policy are true and the insurance risk is as stated, which if not fulfilled renders the policy void.
Justification or mandate to do something, especially in terms of one’s personal conduct.
To warrant; to guarantee.
Property that cannot easily be moved, usually buildings and the ground they are built on.
definitions.example: It's free real estate.

definitions.definition: Space used for a particular purpose.
One who lends, especially money; specifically, a bank or other entity that specializes in granting loans.
A trench; a long, shallow indentation, as for irrigation or drainage.
definitions.example: Digging ditches has long been considered one of the most demanding forms of manual labor.

definitions.definition: To discard or abandon.
definitions.example: Once the sun came out we ditched our rain-gear and started a campfire.

definitions.definition: To deliberately crash-land an airplane on water.
definitions.example: When the second engine failed, the pilot was forced to ditch; their last location was just south of the Azores.

definitions.definition: To deliberately not attend classes; to play hookey.
definitions.example: The truant officer caught Louise ditching with her friends, and her parents were forced to pay a fine.

definitions.definition: To dig ditches.
definitions.example: Enclosure led to fuller winter employment in hedging and ditching.

definitions.definition: To dig ditches around.
definitions.example: The soldiers ditched the tent to prevent flooding.

definitions.definition: To throw into a ditch.
definitions.example: The engine was ditched and turned on its side.

definitions.definition: Dirt ingrained on the hands, or in cracks, crevices, etc.
To smear, daub, plaster, or impregnate, especially with dirt which becomes hard and ingrained.
One who controls something.
Any electric or mechanical device for controlling a circuit or system.
A person who audits, and manages the financial affairs of a company or government; a comptroller.
A mechanism that controls or regulates the operation of a machine, especially a peripheral device in a computer.
An iron block, usually bolted to a ship's deck, for controlling the running out of a chain cable. The links of the cable tend to drop into hollows in the block, and thus hold fast until disengaged.
The person who supervises and handles communication with an agent in the field.
The subject of a control verb. See Control (linguistics)
In software applications using the model-view-controller design pattern, the part or parts of the application that treat input and output, forming an interface between models and views.
To dig or redig a trench where one already exists.
One of the bones, usually bearing teeth, which form the framework of the mouth.
The part of the face below the mouth.
definitions.example: His jaw dropped in amazement.

definitions.definition: Anything resembling the jaw of an animal in form or action; especially plural, the mouth or way of entrance.
definitions.example: the jaws of a pass; the jaws of darkness; the jaws of death.

definitions.definition: A notch or opening.
A notched or forked part, adapted for holding an object in place.
definitions.example: the jaw of a railway-car pedestal.

definitions.definition: One of a pair of opposing parts which are movable towards or from each other, for grasping or crushing anything between them.
definitions.example: the jaws of a vise; the jaws of a stone-crushing machine.

definitions.definition: The inner end of a boom or gaff, hollowed in a half circle so as to move freely on a mast.
Impudent or abusive talk.
Axle guard.
The curved part of the cushion marking the entry to the pocket.
To assail or abuse by scolding.
To scold; to clamor.
To talk; to converse.
(of a ball) To stick in the jaws of a pocket.
(used in certain set phrases like jaw harp, jaw harpist and jaw's-trump)

A mostly herbivorous insect of the order Orthoptera, noted for its ability to jump long distances and for the habit of some species communicating by stridulation; they are related to but distinct from crickets.
A cocktail made with crème de menthe and optionally with crème de cacao.
A young student in initial stages of training who has been chosen on account of their obvious talent.
In ordinary square or upright pianos of London make, the escapement lever or jack, so made that it can be taken out and replaced with the key.
(British dialect) A puff or whiff, especially of tobacco smoke.
A trick or ploy; a stratagem.
A hairstyle whereby the forelock is brushed and/or gelled upward, often associated with the styles of the 1950s.
To arrange (the hair) in such a manner.
A young girl, especially as promiscuous; a prostitute.
The vulva or vagina.
Digested waste material (typically solid or semi-solid) discharged from the bowels; excrement.
To hold very tightly, as to not fall off.
definitions.example: Seaweed clung to the anchor.

definitions.definition: To adhere to an object, without being affixed, in such a way as to follow its contours. Used especially of fabrics and films.
To cause to adhere to, especially by twining round or embracing.
To cause to dry up or wither.
To dry up or wither.
definitions.example: Wood clings.

definitions.definition: (with preposition to) to be fond of, to feel strongly about and dependent on
To produce a high-pitched ringing sound, like a small bell.
The act of one who clings.

A type of drama (a film, a television show, or a play) that combines elements of documentary and drama, to some extent showing real events and to some extent using actors performing recreations of documented events.
A sour liquid formed by the fermentation of alcohol used as a condiment or preservative; a dilute solution of acetic acid.
Any variety of vinegar.
definitions.example: a range of herb-flavoured vinegars

definitions.definition: To season or otherwise treat with vinegar.
The quality of being legitimate or valid; validity.
Lawfulness of birth or origin; directness of descent as affecting the royal succession.
(animal anatomy) a breathing organ of fish and other aquatic animals
(of a fish) a gill slit or gill cover
definitions.example: Gill nets are designed to catch a fish by the gills.

definitions.definition: One of the radial folds on the underside of the cap of a mushroom, on the surface of which the spore-producing organs are borne
(animal anatomy) the fleshy flap that hangs below the beak of a fowl; a wattle
The flesh under or about the chin; a wattle
(spinning) one of the combs of closely ranged steel pins which divide the ribbons of flax fiber or wool into fewer parallel filaments
To remove the gills from a fish as part of gutting and cleaning it
To catch (a fish) in a gillnet
To be or become entangled in a gillnet
A drink measure for spirits and wine (size varies regionally but it is about one quarter of a pint)
A measuring jug holding a quarter or half a pint
Rivulet
Ravine
A two-wheeled frame for transporting timber
A leech
A female ferret
A promiscuous woman; harlot, wanton
A prostitute
To act as a prostitute.
To accuse or bring criminal charges against.
definitions.example: The newspapers incriminated the innocent man unjustly.

definitions.definition: To indicate the guilt of.
definitions.example: We have all sorts of evidence which incriminates you.

definitions.definition: Causing, showing, or proving that one is guilty of wrongdoing.
To draw into a situation; to cause to be involved.
definitions.example: Avoid him. He will embroil you in his fights.

definitions.definition: To implicate in confusion; to complicate; to jumble.
A man's headdress made by winding a length of cloth round the head.
A woman's close-fitting hat with little or no brim.
The complete set of whorls of a spiral shell.
Senescence; the bodily and mental deterioration associated with old age.
The losing of memory and reason due to senescence.
definitions.example: He was entering his years of senility and not liking it a bit.

definitions.definition: An elderly, senile person.
A parasitic roundworm, Strongyloides stercoralis, which causes strongyloidiasis.
The pinworm.

(grammar) A type of noun that refers anaphorically to another noun or noun phrase, but which cannot ordinarily be preceded by a determiner and rarely takes an attributive adjective. English examples include I, you, him, who, me, my, each other.

A racquet sport played indoors on a court by two opposing players (singles) or two opposing pairs of players (doubles), in which a shuttlecock is volleyed over a net and the competitions are presided by an umpire in British English and a referee in American English.
A cooling summer drink made with claret, sugar and soda water.
A doctrine, opposing materialism, that claims transcendency of the divine being, the altogether spiritual character of reality and the value of inwardness of consciousness.
A belief that the dead communicate with the living, especially through a medium. Used in a broader sense than spiritism/Kardecism.
The quality or state of being spiritual.
A hole in the ground used to access the sewers or other underground vaults and installations.
A hole providing access to the inside of a boiler, tank etc.
A man's anus, in a sexual context.
A fireplace or pit for grilling food, typically used outdoors and traditionally employing hot charcoal as the heating medium.
definitions.example: We cooked our food on the barbecue.

definitions.definition: A meal or event highlighted by food cooked in such an apparatus.
definitions.example: We're having a barbecue on Saturday, and you're invited.

definitions.definition: Meat, especially pork or beef, which has been cooked in such an apparatus (i.e. smoked over indirect heat from high-smoke fuels) and then chopped up or shredded.
definitions.example: She ordered a plate of barbecue with a side of slaw.

definitions.definition: A hog, ox, or other large animal roasted or broiled whole for a feast.
A floor on which coffee beans are sun-dried.
A framework of sticks.
To cook food on a barbecue; to smoke it over indirect heat from high-smoke fuels.
To grill.
A quadrilateral having opposing sides parallel and four right angles.
Jolly and full of high spirits.
definitions.example: We had a very merry Christmas.

definitions.definition: Festive and full of fun and laughter.
definitions.example: Everyone was merry at the party.

definitions.definition: Brisk
definitions.example: The play moved along at a merry pace.

definitions.definition: Causing laughter, mirth, gladness, or delight.
definitions.example: a merry jest

definitions.definition: Drunk; tipsy
definitions.example: Some of us got a little merry at the office Christmas party.

definitions.definition: An English wild cherry.
In a poor manner or condition; without plenty, or sufficiency, or suitable provision for comfort.
definitions.example: to live poorly

definitions.definition: With little or no success; indifferently; with little profit or advantage.
definitions.example: to do poorly in business

definitions.definition: Meanly; without spirit.
Without skill or merit.
definitions.example: He plays tennis poorly.

definitions.definition: In a negative manner; with disapproval.
definitions.example: I think poorly of them.

definitions.definition: Ill, unwell, sick
That which clothes, covers, conceals, or protects; a garment.
Especially, the dress for the dead; a winding sheet.
That which covers or shelters like a shroud.
A covered place used as a retreat or shelter, as a cave or den; also, a vault or crypt.
A rope or cable serving to support the mast sideways.
One of the two annular plates at the periphery of a water wheel, which form the sides of the buckets; a shroud plate.
To cover with a shroud.
To conceal or hide from view, as if by a shroud.
definitions.example: The details of the plot were shrouded in mystery.

definitions.definition: To take shelter or harbour.
The branching top of a tree; foliage.
To lop the branches from (a tree).
The act of imposing taxes and the fact of being taxed.
A particular system of taxing people or companies
The revenue gained from taxes
A self-written biography; the story of one's own life.
A three-dimensional curve — a spiral wound around a helix.
Furtive, stealthy or catlike.
Thin; lank; lean.
Of a garment: close-fitting; clingy.
A member of a parliament, congress or an elected national legislative body of another name.
A person well-versed in parliamentary procedure.

An officer in most legislative bodies charged with being well-versed in the parliamentary rules of that legislative house, and whose rulings are taken as authoritative, to be appealed only to the whole of the house itself under special rules.
Of or relating to a parliament; favouring the establishment of a parliament.
definitions.example: a parliamentarian democracy; the parliamentarian movement

definitions.definition: Of or relating to the Parliamentarians (supporters of the parliament during the English Civil War (1642–1651)).
A lively style of music originating from India.
A traditional Punjabi folk dance, originally a celebration of the harvest.
Any of various modern Punjabi dance styles of the 1950s and 1990s.
Any style of electronic dance music (EDM) influenced by the musics of the Indian subcontinent.
Something, such as a glove or other pledge, thrown down as a challenge to combat (now usually figurative).
Something valuable deposited as a guarantee or pledge; security, ransom.
To give or deposit as a pledge or security; to pawn.
To wager, to bet.
To bind by pledge, or security; to engage.
A measure; a standard of measure; an instrument to determine dimensions, distance, or capacity; a standard
An act of measuring.
An estimate.
Any instrument for ascertaining or regulating the level, state, dimensions or forms of things
A thickness of sheet metal or wire designated by any of several numbering schemes.
The distance between the rails of a railway.
A semi-norm; a function that assigns a non-negative size to all vectors in a vector space.
The number of stitches per inch, centimetre, or other unit of distance.
Relative positions of two or more vessels with reference to the wind.
definitions.example: A vessel has the weather gauge of another when on the windward side of it, and the lee gauge when on the lee side of it.

definitions.definition: The depth to which a vessel sinks in the water.
(plastering) The quantity of plaster of Paris used with common plaster to make it set more quickly.
That part of a shingle, slate, or tile, which is exposed to the weather, when laid; also, one course of such shingles, slates, or tiles.
A unit of measurement which describes how many spheres of bore diameter of a shotgun can be had from one pound of lead; 12 gauge is roughly equivalent to .75 caliber.
(by extension) A shotgun (synecdoche for 12 gauge shotgun, the most common chambering for combat and hunting shotguns).
A tunnel-like ear piercing consisting of a hollow ring embedded in the lobe.
To measure or determine with a gauge; to measure the capacity of.
To estimate.
To appraise the character or ability of; to judge of.
To draw into equidistant gathers by running a thread through it.
To mix (a quantity of ordinary plaster) with a quantity of plaster of Paris.
To chip, hew or polish (stones, bricks, etc) to a standard size and/or shape.
A subspecies of plum, Prunus domestica subsp. italica.
A quart pot.
A pint pot.
(metonymically) A drink.
A tobacco pipe.
A chamberpot.
A small quantity of anything.
Marijuana
A residence, especially a condominium or cabin, where a couple (particularly a newly cohabiting/married couple) can enjoy each other's company.
A place suitable for or used for having sexual intercourse.
The vagina.
An irregular heartbeat.
A disease entity involving such beats, such as atrial fibrillation, ventricular tachycardia, AV nodal reentrant tachycardia, or others.
Brought from far away.
Not likely; difficult to believe.
definitions.example: He is full of far-fetched ideas to make money.

definitions.definition: A piece of music or a movement from a larger piece such as a symphony; especially, a piece of music played in a playful manner.
Observing or identifying wild birds in their natural environment.
The total number of votes of a given electorate.
definitions.example: The president was elected even though he received only 40% of the popular vote.

definitions.definition: The indentation or bump remaining in the abdomen of mammals where the umbilical cord was attached before birth.
The central part or point of anything; the middle.
A navel orange.
An eye on the underside of a carronade for securing it to a carriage.

A fallacious objection to an argument or factual claim by appealing to a characteristic or belief of the person making the argument or claim, rather than by addressing the substance of the argument or producing evidence against the claim; an attempt to argue against an opponent's idea by discrediting the opponent himself or herself.
A personal attack.
Of or relating to this kind of fallacious objection.
definitions.example: Well that's an ad hominem argument.

definitions.definition: In an ad hominem manner.
definitions.example: He tried to make his case by arguing ad hominem.

definitions.definition: A substance that increases the rate of a chemical reaction without being consumed in the process.
Someone or something that encourages progress or change.
definitions.example: Economic development and integration are working as a catalyst for peace.

definitions.definition: An inciting incident that sets the successive conflict into motion.
A catalytic converter.
Either of two species of Old World wading bird in the genus Tringa that have long red legs.
A species of moss (Ceratodon purpureus), also known as fire moss or purple horn toothed moss.
Lady's thumb or redleg (Persicaria maculosa), an herb in the buckwheat family.
A bare-legged person; one of the Scottish Highlanders, who wore kilts.
A conversation held by means of a telephone.
A narrow-brimmed felt hat.
(shapes) A quadrilateral with sides of equal length (rhombus), having two acute and two obtuse angles.
A small tablet (originally diamond-shaped) or medicated sweet used to ease a sore throat.
To form into the shape of a lozenge.
To mark or emblazon with a lozenge.
An implement for washing floors, or the like, made of a piece of cloth, or a collection of thrums, or coarse yarn, fastened to a handle.
A wash with a mop; the act of mopping
definitions.example: He gave the floor a quick mop to soak up the spilt juice.

definitions.definition: A dense head of hair.
definitions.example: He ran a comb through his mop and hurried out the door.

definitions.definition: A fair where servants are hired.
The young of any animal; also, a young girl; a moppet.
A made-up face; a grimace.
To rub, scrub, clean or wipe with a mop, or as if with a mop.
definitions.example: to mop (or scrub) a floor

definitions.definition: To make a wry expression with the mouth.
Astuteness often marked by a certain sense of cunning or artful deception.
Deceptiveness, deceit, fraud, duplicity, dishonesty.
To deceive, beguile, bewile.
Taking place outside the walls of an institution, especially a school or university.
Describing teaching of students who are not resident at such an institution.
A town containing merchants who have exclusive right, under royal authority, to purchase or produce certain goods for export; also, the body of such merchants seen as a group.
(by extension) Place of supply; source.
The principal commodity produced in a town or region.
A basic or essential supply.
definitions.example: Rice is a staple in the diet of many cultures.

definitions.definition: A recurring topic or character.
Short fiber, as of cotton, sheep’s wool, or the like, which can be spun into yarn or thread.
Unmanufactured material; raw material.
To sort according to its staple.
definitions.example: to staple cotton

definitions.definition: Relating to, or being market of staple for, commodities.
definitions.example: a staple town

definitions.definition: Established in commerce; occupying the markets; settled.
definitions.example: a staple trade

definitions.definition: Fit to be sold; marketable.
Regularly produced or manufactured in large quantities; belonging to wholesale traffic; principal; chief.
A wire fastener used to secure stacks of paper by penetrating all the sheets and curling around.
A wire fastener used to secure something else by penetrating and curling.
definitions.example: Can you believe they use staples to hold cars together these days?

definitions.definition: A U-shaped metal fastener, used to attach fence wire or other material to posts or structures.
definitions.example: The rancher used staples to attach the barbed wire to the fence-posts.

definitions.definition: One of a set of U-shaped metal rods hammered into a structure, such as a piling or wharf, which serve as a ladder.
definitions.example: Fortunately, there were staples in the quay wall, and she was able to climb out of the water.

definitions.definition: A shaft, smaller and shorter than the principal one, joining different levels.
A small pit.
A district granted to an abbey.
A post; prop; support
To secure with a staple.
To ride a wave, usually on a surfboard.
To browse the Internet, television, etc.
The pastime or sport of riding surf on a surfboard.
The activity of browsing the Internet.
A pouch or cavity in any organ or tissue, especially the paranasal sinus.
A channel for transmitting venous blood.
A notch or depression between two lobes or teeth in the margin of an organ.
An abnormal cavity or passage such as a fistula, caused by the destruction of tissue.
A bay of the sea; a recess in the shore.
A tropical American evergreen tree, Carica papaya, having large, yellow, edible fruit
The fruit of this tree.
An orange colour, like that of papaya flesh.
To throw (something) with force.
To utter (harsh or derogatory speech), especially at its target.
To participate in the sport of hurling.
To vomit.
To twist or turn.
To move rapidly with a noise; to whirl.
To convey in a wheeled vehicle.
The act by which something is hurled or thrown.
An Irish game of ancient Celtic origin. It is played with an ash stick called a hurley (camán in Irish) and a hard leather ball called a sliotar.
A Cornish street game resembling rugby, played with a silver ball.
Any of several parasitic trematode worms that infect the livers of various mammals, including humans.
The period around the summer solstice; about 21st June in the northern hemisphere.
The first day of summer
The middle of summer.
Midsummer Day, the English quarter day.
A pagan holiday or Wiccan Sabbat
Happening in the middle of summer.
A hemispherical pit created by the impact of a meteorite or other object.
The basin-like opening or mouth of a volcano, through which the chief eruption comes; similarly, the mouth of a geyser, about which a cone of silica is often built up.
The pit left by the explosion of a mine or bomb.
(by extension) Any large, roughly circular depression or hole.
To form craters in a surface (of a planet or moon).
To collapse catastrophically; to become devastated or completely destroyed.
To crash or fall.
definitions.example: He cratered into that snow bank about five seconds after his first lesson.

definitions.definition: An ancient Greek vessel for mixing water and wine.
A living being; an animal or (sometimes derogatory) a human.
definitions.example: He's a creature of habit.   insects and other creatures

definitions.definition: A created thing, whether animate or inanimate; a creation.
A being subservient to or dependent upon another.
To allow to descend.
definitions.example: They let down the rope and I fastened it to the basket.

definitions.definition: To disappoint; to betray or fail somebody
definitions.example: I promised him I would meet him there, and I will not let him down.

definitions.definition: (of clothing) To lengthen by undoing and resewing a hem.
To reduce one's level of effort.
To soften in tempering.
definitions.example: to let down tools or cutlery

definitions.definition: A decapod crustacean (not a true crab) from the superfamily Paguroidea, which salvages empty seashells or other portable objects to permanently shelter and protect its soft abdomen.
One who redeems; one who provides redemption.
A rolling down.
A descent, especially one that passes through a series of revolutions, or by succession
The transference of a right to a successor, or of a power from one body to another.
Degeneration (as opposed to evolution).
definitions.example: It is quite disheartening to witness the devolution of our nation's political discourse over the past several years.

definitions.definition: The transfer of some powers, and the delegation of some functions, from a central sovereign government to local government; eg. from Westminster to Scottish parliament and Welsh assembly.
definitions.example: The question of whether England should receive devolution like Scotland and Wales have has dogged British politics for years.

definitions.definition: Any of many herbs, of the genus Ranunculus, having yellow flowers; the crowfoot.
Any flower of the genus Narcissus; a daffodil.
Affectionate or ironic term of address.
(often disapproving) a puritanical person
(often disapproving) acting or behaving according to the Puritan morals (e.g. propagating modesty), especially with regard to pleasure, nudity and sex
The right to proceed first in traffic, on land, on water or in the air. Also in metaphorical senses.
A legal right of passage over another's land or pathways.
A legal easement granted for the construction of a roadway or railway.
Land on which a right of way exists.
The area modified for passage of a railway; often specifically the railbed and tracks.
The priority granted to the first person to properly execute an attack.
The bone of the upper arm.
To retract what one has spoken, to unsay.
(sometimes postpositive) Not spoken; not said.
(sometimes postpositive) Not formally articulated or stated; implicit or understood.
definitions.example: The unspoken rule is to start a new pot of coffee when it is empty.
